content.title: Rajbhasha Gaurav Puraskar Scheme for writing original book in Hindi
content.beneficiary: Authors writing original books in Hindi
content.details: The scheme 'Rajbhasha Gaurav Puraskar Scheme for Writing Original Book in Hindi' was launched by the Department of Official Language, Ministry of Home Affairs, Government of India with an objective to encourage writing books originally in Hindi and to promote Official Language. Under the scheme, the citizens of India will be awarded for writing original books in various subjects.
benefits: First Prize: ₹2,00,000/-, a certificate and a memento for knowledge and science-based subjects
Second Prize: ₹1,25,000/-, a certificate and a memento for knowledge and science-based subjects
Third Prize: ₹75,000/-, a certificate and a memento for knowledge and science-based subjects
First Prize: ₹1,50,000/-, a certificate and a memento for Forensic Science, Police, Criminology Research and Police Administration
Second Prize: ₹1,00,000/-, a certificate and a memento for Forensic Science, Police, Criminology Research and Police Administration
First Prize: ₹1,50,000/-, a certificate and a memento for subjects related to Culture, Religion, Arts and Heritage
Second Prize: ₹1,00,000/-, a certificate and a memento for subjects related to Culture, Religion, Arts and Heritage
First Prize: ₹1,50,000/-, a certificate and a memento for writing original book in Hindi in the field of law
Second Prize: ₹1,00,000/-, a certificate and a memento for writing original book in Hindi in the field of law
eligibility: The author/co-author should be a citizen of India.

The book should be written in specified genres such as Engineering, Electronics, Computer Science, Physics, Biology, Energy, Space Science, Medicine, Chemistry, Information Technology, Management, Psychology, etc.
Books must be original works in Hindi; translated books are not accepted.
Books published from 1st January to 31st December are acceptable.
Books must contain at least 100 pages.
exclusions: Books previously awarded by any government organization are not eligible.
Books in the form of a thesis for Ph.D., poems, novels, stories, plays, or textbooks are not eligible.
content.application_process: Offline. Applicants need to visit the official website of the department and download the application proforma, fill it out, and send it to the department before the last date.

faqs.question: What is the objective of the scheme?
faqs.answer: To encourage writing books originally in Hindi and to promote the Official Language.

faqs.question: What genres are considered under the scheme?
faqs.answer: Books should be written on specified genres including Engineering, Forensic Science, Culture, Religion, Arts, Heritage, and Law.

faqs.question: Are translated books accepted under the scheme?
faqs.answer: No, only original works in Hindi are accepted.

faqs.question: What is the minimum page requirement for eligible books?
faqs.answer: The books submitted under the scheme should contain a minimum of 100 pages.
